page.title: 02Leintwardine and District 2.
page.content: {Points of Interest.}The house at the corner of Church St. and High St. is probably the oldest in the village. It was the original{Court House}for the district. Opposite it is{Sawpit Bank,}but the Sawpit has now been filled in. The village stocks stood here, and there was a small cell dug out of the bank which served as a lock-up.{The Rope {Walk}runs from the south side of the Ludlow road at the Todding to Kinton Lane. The hut used by the Ropemaker can still be seen at the top end.{ {Leintwardine House}was once the residence of{General Sir Banastre {Tarleton,}of interest to Americans on account of his connection with the American War of Independence. General Tarleton is buried in the Churchyard and a Wall Monument to his memory is set in a Side Chapel of the Church.
